nodes.value: Reservar
to book
to reserve accommodation, a ticket, etc.
You should book your flight tickets in advance.
Vacaciones de verano
summer holiday
a vacation taken during the summer months
They are planning a summer holiday to the coast.
Esperar
to wait
to stay where one is or delay action
Please wait here until your name is called.
Más tiempo, por más tiempo (en negativas/condicionales)
any longer
for any further period of time
I can't stay any longer, I have to go.
Completo, todo reservado
fully booked
all places or tickets are reserved
The popular restaurant is often fully booked on weekends.
Tienes razón
You're right
expression of agreement with someone
You're right, we should check the weather first.
Adónde ir
where to go
which place or destination to choose
With so many options, it's hard to decide where to go.
¿Qué tal...? / ¿Y si...? (para sugerir)
How about...?
used for making a suggestion
How about watching a movie tonight?
Buen tiempo
good weather
pleasant atmospheric conditions (sunny, warm)
We had good weather throughout our vacation.
Siempre
always
at all times; on all occasions
She always brings a book to read on the train.
Podríamos intentarlo/probar
We could try
suggesting a possibility to attempt something
This recipe looks difficult, but we could try making it.
Gastar dinero
to spend money
to use money to pay for goods or services
He needs to be careful not to spend too much money.
Mucho dinero
lots of money
a large sum or amount of money
It costs lots of money to buy a house in the city.
Caro/a
expensive
costing a lot of money to buy or do
Designer clothes are usually very expensive.
Realmente, muy (intensificador)
really
very; to a great degree (used as an intensifier)
This is a really interesting book.
Idioma, lengua
language
the system of communication used by people
She speaks three foreign languages fluently.
Eso no importa
That doesn't matter
it is not important or significant
If you're a bit late, that doesn't matter.
Buscar en internet
to look on the internet
to search for information online using the web
You can look on the internet for cheap flight deals.
Podría (posibilidad)
might
used to express possibility in the present or future
Take an umbrella, it might rain later.
Encontrar
to find
to discover or locate something
I can't find my keys anywhere.
Ofertas baratas, buenas ofertas
cheap deals
bargains; products or services at low prices
She is always looking for cheap deals when shopping online.
Es una buena idea
That's a good idea
expression of approval for a suggestion or plan
Let's go to the beach. That's a good idea!
¿Buscarás? / ¿Puedes buscar?
Will you look?
asking someone to search in the future
The information is online; will you look for it?
No voy a (futuro negado)
I'm not going to
expressing a negative future intention or plan
I'm not going to the party tonight.
Suficiente dinero
enough money
a sufficient or adequate amount of money
We don't have enough money for a new car.
Cruzar
to cross
to go from one side to the other of something
Always look both ways before you cross the road.
Puente
bridge
a structure carrying a path over an obstacle
The old stone bridge crosses the river.
Flores
flowers
the reproductive part of a plant, often colorful
She received a beautiful bouquet of flowers for her birthday.
Elefante
elephant
a very large grey mammal with a trunk and tusks
We saw a majestic elephant on our safari.
Romper(se)
to break
to separate into pieces; to stop working
If you drop the vase, it will break.
Caer(se)
to fall
to move downwards, typically rapidly and freely
Be careful not to fall on the icy path.
Cocodrilos
crocodiles
large predatory reptiles with long jaws
Warning signs indicated crocodiles in the river.
Gritar
to scream
to give a long, loud, piercing cry
She wanted to scream when she saw the horror movie.
Serpiente, víbora
snake
a long, legless reptile, often feared
A colorful snake slithered across the path.
Morder
to bite
to cut into something with the teeth
The dog is friendly and doesn't bite.
Poder (habilidad, permiso, posibilidad)
can
used to express ability or possibility
He can speak Spanish fluently.
Guardar, quedarse con, conservar
to keep
to retain possession of something
You can keep this pen if you like it.
Mucho más fácil
a lot easier
significantly less difficult or complicated
Using this new tool makes the job a lot easier.
Necesitamos reservar nuestras vacaciones de verano.
We need to book our summer holiday.
Si esperamos más tiempo, estará todo completo.
If we wait any longer, everything will be fully booked.
Tienes razón.
You're right.
Pero todavía no hemos decidido adónde ir.
But we still haven't decided where to go.
¿Qué tal España?
How about Spain?
Si vamos a España, estoy seguro/a de que tendremos buen tiempo.
If we go to Spain, I'm sure we will have good weather.
Pero siempre vamos a España.
But we always go to Spain.
¿París?
Paris?
Podríamos intentarlo, pero si nos quedamos en París, gastaremos mucho dinero.
We could try, but if we stay in Paris, we will spend lots of money.
París es realmente caro.
Paris is really expensive.
Vale. ¿Qué tal Rumanía o Bulgaria?
OK. How about Romania or Bulgaria?
Podríamos intentar eso.
We could try that.
Pero si vamos allí, no sabremos el idioma.
But if we go there, we won't know the language.
Eso no importa.
That doesn't matter.
Lo sé, y si buscamos en internet, podríamos encontrar algunas ofertas baratas.
I know, and if we look on the internet, we might find some cheap deals.
Es una buena idea.
That's a good idea.
Si tienes tiempo más tarde, ¿buscarás?
If you have time later, will you look?
Vale. Pero no voy a ir a París.
OK. But I'm not going to Paris.
¡No tengo suficiente dinero!
I don't have enough money!
Cuando el hombre cruce el puente, le dará las flores a su novia
When the man crosses the bridge, he will give his girlfriend the flowers
Si el elefante camina sobre el puente, el puente se romperá
If the elephant walks on the bridge, the bridge will break
Si el puente se rompe, el elefante se caerá
If the bridge breaks, the elephant will fall
Si el elefante se cae, los cocodrilos se lo comerán
If the elephant falls, the crocodiles will eat it
Si el hombre se cae, su novia gritará
If the man falls, his girlfriend will scream
Si su novia grita, la serpiente se despertará
If his girlfriend screams, the snake will wake up
Si la serpiente se despierta, morderá a su novia.
If the snake wakes up, it will bite his girlfriend.
Si el hombre no cruza el puente, puede quedarse con las flores
If the man doesn't cross the bridge, he can keep the flowers
Si se queda con las flores, será mucho más fácil
If he keeps the flowers, it will be a lot easier
